intro: Polycarpon benthamii, commonly known as the Bentham's knotweed, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Polycarpon benthamii is notable for its adaptability and resilience in arid environments.
